org.diirt.graphene.profile.utils

Class DatasetFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.diirt.graphene.profile.utils.DatasetFactory

  • public final class DatasetFactory
extends Object
    Factory object to create datasets.
    Author:
    asbarber

    • Method Detail

      • defaultDatasetSizes

        public static List<Integer> defaultDatasetSizes()
        Default set of dataset sizes to test profiling on, on a logarithmic scale. The values are 10^1, 10^2, ... , 10^6.
        Returns:
        a list with values of 10^n for n = 1 to n = 6 (a logarithmic scale from 10 to 1,000,000)

      • logarathmicDatasetSizes

        public static List<Integer> logarathmicDatasetSizes(int min,
                                                    int max,
                                                    int base)
        Generates a set of dataset sizes to test profiling on, on a logarithmic scale. The values are base^min, base^(min+1), ... , base^max.
        Parameters:
        min - minimum power to raise the base to
        max - maximum power to raise the base to
        base - raise this to the power of n
        Returns:
        a list with values of base^n for n = min to n = max

      • makePoint1DGaussianRandomData

        public static Point1DDataset makePoint1DGaussianRandomData(int nSamples)
        Generates Point1D data that can be used in rendering. The data set has the following properties:
        1. Size of data (number of points) is nSamples
        3. Random data
        4. Gaussian distribution from 0 to 1
        Parameters:
        nSamples - number of points in data
        Returns:
        a set of data to be drawn

      • makePoint2DGaussianRandomData

        public static Point2DDataset makePoint2DGaussianRandomData(int nSamples)
        Generates Point2D data that can be used in rendering. The data set has the following properties:
        1. Size of data (number of points) is nSamples
        3. Random y-values
        4. y-values are sorted ascending and plotted against sorted index (sorted index is x-value)
        5. Gaussian distribution from 0 to 1
        Parameters:
        nSamples - number of points in data
        Returns:
        a set of data to be drawn

      • makePoint3DWithLabelGaussianRandomData

        public static Point3DWithLabelDataset makePoint3DWithLabelGaussianRandomData(int nSamples)
        Generates Point3D data that can be used in rendering. The data set has the following properties:
        1. Size of data (number of points) is nSamples
        3. Random y-values
        4. y-values are sorted ascending and plotted against sorted index (sorted index is x-value)
        5. Gaussian distribution from 0 to 1
        Parameters:
        nSamples - number of points in data
        Returns:
        a set of data to be drawn

      • makeCell1DGaussianRandomData

        public static Cell1DDataset makeCell1DGaussianRandomData(int nSamples)
        Generates Cell1D data that can be used in rendering. The data set has the following properties:
        1. Size of data is xSamples * ySamples
        3. Random cell data
        4. Gaussian distribution of values from 0 to 1
        Parameters:
        nSamples - number of points in data
        Returns:
        a set of data to be drawn

      • makeCell2DGaussianRandomData

        public static Cell2DDataset makeCell2DGaussianRandomData(int xSamples,
                                                         int ySamples)
        Generates Cell2D data that can be used in rendering. The data set has the following properties:
        1. Size of data is xSamples * ySamples
        3. Random cell data
        4. Gaussian distribution of values from 0 to 1
        Parameters:
        xSamples - number of x-cells in data
        ySamples - number of y-cells in data
        Returns:
        a set of data to be drawn
